title: Drift velocity - v-drift and E for 2 wires same I0

content.question: Two wires, which are made of the same material, carry current of equal magnitude <math alttext="I sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> in the same direction, as shown in the figure. Wire <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> is larger in both diameter and length than Wire <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly compares both the electron drift speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> and the magnitude of the electric field <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> within wires <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 2 is greater than E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 2 is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="v sub 2 is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 2 is greater than E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub 1 is greater than v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="E sub 1 is greater than E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
